qas.question: When did the term "Near East" acquire considerable disrepute?
The term "Near East" acquired considerable disrepute in whose eyes?
What was the cause of the onus?
What was the cause of the Hamidian Massacres of Armenians?
When was Robert Hickens' book wrote?

context: In the last years of <a0_0>the 19th century<a0_0/> the term "Near East" acquired considerable disrepute in eyes of the <a1_0>English-speaking public<a1_0/> as did the Ottoman Empire itself. The cause of the onus was <a2_0>the Hamidian Massacres of Armenians<a2_0/> because <a3_0>they were Christians<a3_0/>, but it seemed to spill over into the protracted conflicts of the Balkans. For a time, "Near East" meant primarily the Balkans. Robert Hichens' book The Near East (<a4_0>1913)<a4_0/> is subtitled Dalmatia, Greece and Constantinople.
